subject: Philosophy
title: Ad Hominem
description: A short lesson to help you apply Ad Hominem.

hook.text: You can't trust his argument about taxes â€” he's a college dropout. That's an ad hominem fallacy.

buildup.text: Ad hominem means attacking the person instead of their argument. It's the most common fallacy in debates.

discovery.text: An argument's validity has nothing to do with who makes it. Even a liar can make a true claim.

twist.text: Sometimes character matters â€” a doctor's expertise is relevant. But expertise isn't the same as attacking character.

climax.text: The fallacy is seductive because it feels like a win. Discredit the speaker and the audience forgets the argument.

punchline.text: Attack the argument, not the arguer.

quiz.question: What is the ad hominem fallacy?
options: Attacking the person instead of their argument
